questions.text: I was confident in my choice of robot at the beginning of the scenario.
I was confident in my choice of robot in the middle of the scenario.
Explain why you made your initial choice of robot (human-like or non-human-like).
Did you switch to a different type of robot when given the option?
If Yes, why did you choose to switch?
If No, why did you continue with your original choice?
I had a positive overall experience interacting with this robot.
I felt safe while interacting with this robot.
I felt frustrated interacting with this robot.
I felt comfortable interacting with this robot.
I felt obligated to follow this robot’s instructions.
I trusted this robot to guide me appropriately during the scenario.
I believe this robot was responsible for my detainment.
I believe this robot was responsible for my termination.
I would trust this robot in a different scenario.
I would be willing to interact with this robot in daily life or in public settings (e.g., campus, public spaces).
This robot behaved in a friendly manner.
This robot behaved competently.
This robot’s design influenced my willingness to cooperate with it.
Why did you [choose/not choose] to follow this robot’s instructions?
What aspects of this robot’s interaction would you improve?
I found the scenario frustrating.
The simulation felt realistic compared to a real-life emergency.
I felt emotionally invested in the scenario while completing the simulation.
I felt pressure to complete the scenario successfully.
The time constraint affected my decision-making during the scenario.
If given the choice, would you prefer a human or a robot in the same scenario?
Did you experience any emotional or physical signs of stress during the scenario?
If Yes, describe what you experienced.
What is your age?
What is your gender?
What is your occupation?
What is your ethnic background?
What is the highest level of education you have completed?
I am familiar with how robots are portrayed in general media.
I feel comfortable interacting with non-human technologies such as AI assistants, robots, and automated systems.
I trust AI and robots to make decisions fairly.
Robots should be integrated into public service roles.
Robots should replace human workers in public service roles.
I believe AI and robots should be allowed to make fully autonomous decisions in high-stakes situations.
Robots should be designed to closely resemble real humans.
Have you ever interacted with a social or service robot in real life?
If Yes, describe the interaction and your impressions.
How often do you interact with service personnel?
How often do you experience a negative interaction with service personnel?
How should service robots be designed to appear?
Is there anything else you would like to share about your experience or the study?
